Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In partnership with Good Shepherd, CBA supported the establishment of the Financial Independence Hub (FIH). This service provides free, confidential, ongoing support for people who have experienced financial abuse Ã¢ÂÂ feel more confident with money and plan for the future, regardless of who they bank with.
column20: Financial Independence Hub, Good Shepherd, financial abuse

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Indigenous Customer Support Program, established in 2021, continued to bring efforts underway across the Bank together to support First Nations customers. This year, CBA completed community visits to APY Lands (SA), Mornington Island, Palm Island (QLD), Djarindjin, Ardyaloon, Beagle Bay, and Bidyadanga (WA) to deliver remote banking support. These visits will inform CBA's future remote banking support.
column20: Indigenous Customer Support Program, First Nations customer, community visit

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA understands the importance of building strong financial awareness and habits in children to help them become financially resilient in the digital economy. CBA's earning-and-learning app, Kit, is being used by thousands of families in Australia. The app and prepaid card are designed with kids in mind while providing oversight for parents and carers. A recent Money Matters Report found families using Kit were more likely to save money, earn money on their own and apply positive spending strategies when purchasing an item.
column20: Kit, financial awareness, child

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA partnered with the First Nations Foundation in 2022 to run a financial literacy program pilot called My Money Dream. The program was available across remote branches for First Nations customers to support positive money habits and build financial prosperity.
column20: First Nations Foundation, financial literacy, My Money Dream

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, CBA launched Equal Access Toolkits in all branches to make it easier for customers with different accessibility requirements to Bank with us. Each toolkit includes items to support various accessibility requirements when customers visit CBA and help them complete tasks.
column20: Equal Access Toolkit, accessibility requirement, customer

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA continues its ambition to improve its accessibility, helping to remove barriers for customers with temporary, situational or permanent disabilities. CBA's Accessibility and Inclusion Plan guides how it makes its products, technology and workplaces accessible for all.
column20: Accessibility and Inclusion Plan, disability, customer

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Using the power of its Customer Engagement Engine, CBA can proactively connect with those whom a natural disaster may impact with offers of support that align with their needs, such as deferring a loan or providing an emergency overdraft. In New Zealand, ASB provided disaster relief to customers and communities following major flooding in Auckland.
column20: Customer Engagement Engine, natural disaster, emergency overdraft

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Through the CommBank Staff Foundation, CBA's employees can participate in workplace giving, with the Bank making an additional annual $2 million donation. The Foundation's annual Community Grants program awards 200 community organisations with a $10,000 donation. This year, the grants came after another turbulent year for community organisations, with many facing rising costs while recovering from the pandemic.
column20: CommBank Staff Foundation, donation, Community Grant

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA remains committed to helping victim-survivors of domestic violence and financial abuse by continuing its support for customers, employees and communities through CommBank Next Chapter. Since the inception of CommBank Next Chapter in 2020, the program has supported 52,277 interactions with people impacted by domestic and family violence and provided free, confidential support and referrals to help rebuild financial independence.
column20: CommBank Next Chapter, domestic violence, financial independence

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA's Elevate status from Reconciliation Australia recognises its leadership role in driving reconciliation, both within CBA and nationally. CBA released its 2023-2025 Elevate Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP), setting out an ambitious plan to improve access to CBA's products and services and help remove barriers to employment, business and supplier opportunities.
column20: Reconciliation Action Plan, leadership role, reconciliation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA is proud to work with Football Australia, which aims to make football the first sport to reach gender parity in community participation. As an Official Supporter of the FIFA Women's World Cup 2023 and partner of the CommBank Matildas, CBA is committed to helping players of all ages and abilities participate in one of the country's favourite sports.
column20: Football Australia, gender parity, community participation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA's Regional Movers Index shows strong population movement to Australia's regional areas in the past year Ã¢ÂÂ drawn by employment and business opportunities across various sectors.
column20: Regional Movers Index, population movement, business opportunity

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: CBA has supported regional communities and businesses for over 100 years by providing regional and agricultural businesses with specialist expertise. This year, CBA is proud to partner with Newcastle Airport as the sole financier for a $240 million package to support its expansion. The project will significantly increase the airport's capacity, improve connectivity and support future growth and opportunity in the Hunter Region.
column20: Newcastle Airport, sole financier, expansion

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: CBA's Indigenous Advisory Council (IAC) was formed in 2014. The IAC consists of senior CBA leaders, a First Nations CommBank employee representative, and external Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander leaders to guide the development and implementation of its reconciliation program. Through the IAC's support, CBA developed a better understanding of CBA's role in reconciliation, including when it is appropriate to take a leading role on issues and when it is more appropriate to support other voices in their advocacy.
column20: Indigenous Advisory Council, reconciliation program, advocacy

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: CBA is required by law to have Target Market Determinations that describe the particular cohort of customers the product is intended for Ã¢ÂÂ taking into account their circumstances, financial literacy, potential vulnerability or hardship and accessibility requirements. It helps reduce the risk of customer harm from developing and distributing CBA's products.
column20: Target Market Determination, financial literacy, customer harm

Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: All employees at CBA undertake annual mandatory privacy training. The Bank also maintains an information security training and awareness program that involves employee participation to reinforce its employees' and contractors' information security roles and responsibilities. This program includes online training completed when joining the Bank and after that annually.
column20: Privacy training, information security training, employee participation

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: CBA's Information Security Policy Framework comprises a suite of policies and procedures that outline how CBA manages cyber and information security risk. It includes clear and detailed cyber security policies and standards. CBA is committed to complying with all relevant regulatory obligations and aligning with industry frameworks, best practices and standards.
column20: Information Security Policy Framework, information security risk, cyber security

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: CBA's Privacy Statement identifies how it collects and handles personal information and how individuals may exercise their privacy rights. The principles of good privacy compliance in the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) are embedded in CBA's internal Group Privacy Policy, Standards and Procedures. They guide how CBA complies with privacy obligations and respond to privacy requests.
column20: Privacy Statement, personal information, privacy right

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: CBA's cyber security team is focused on maintaining its defences against the evolving threat environment, running regular simulations to improve the Bank's response and recovery capability in case of significant events. When significant cyber security breaches occur at other organisations, CBA conducts internal assessments to test its controls and processes against similar threats.
column20: Cyber security team, threat environment, recovery capability

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Last year, CBA conducted two external reviews to assess CBA's cyber program against international best practice benchmarks, ensuring its alignment with global standards. CBA was also one of the nine pilot entities included in APRA's first CPS 234 tripartite assessment, where its domestic and international operations were externally assessed in 2021 and 2022, respectively.
column20: External review, best practice benchmark, cyber program

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column8: Information Security Identity and Access Management Standard
column13: CBA's Information Security Identity and Access Management Standard outlines access requirements such as multi-factor authentication and segregation of duties so that only relevant roles can access systems and information. CBA has implemented software and controls to monitor email, USB and web traffic. This safeguard, known as Data Loss Prevention, is important in keeping Bank and customer data secure.
column20: Information Security Identity and Access Management Standard, access requirement, Data Loss Prevention

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: This year, CBA launched a new app feature, CallerCheck, which allows customers to verify whether a caller claiming to be from CBA is legitimate. Customers can confirm who is calling them by triggering a security message and quickly identify themselves before sharing sensitive information.
column20: CallerCheck, caller, security message

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: CBA introduced NameCheck in NetBank, the CommBank app, progressively to CommBiz payments. The feature uses AI to search account details and check if the customer is paying the intended recipient, helping reduce false billing scams and mistaken payments.
column20: NameCheck, NetBank, CommBiz payment

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: In partnership with Telstra, CBA has been piloting Scam Indicator to help protect joint CBA and Telstra customers from phone scams. The tool uses a machine-learning scam detection model. It is designed to detect certain high-risk scam situations in real-time, enabling CBA to try to contact the customer or put in additional checks. Scam Indicator is expected to be made available to customers later this year.
column20: Scam Indicator, customer, Telstra
